page.title: 05MAMMALS
page.content:
MAMMALS OF SILVERDALE
Silverdale has all the common types of small mammal such as the hedgehog, mole, rat, mouse, vole, shrew and rabbit. It also has four types of bat, the whiskered, long-eared, pipistrelle and noctule.
The woodland contains both red and gray squirrels, the former being the more common and the latter chiefly found in the woods to the south of the village.
There are various carnivores including red fox, badger, stoat and weasel. Also found are the otter and the American mink. Three types of deer are also seen, the fallow, red and roe.
